title: Drawing, The Siren's Grotto at Tivoli, ca. 1813
medium: Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and brown watercolor on cream laid paper
markings: On verso, in purple ink: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c)
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, upper margin: 24
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: On recto: two artists are shown, drawing. Three men at the bottom of the falls. Houses of Tivoli visible at the top. Framing line and caption: “Tivoli 10 – la grotto della sirena;” “20” at the top. On verso: sketches for ceiling with fifteen panels, quarter of a ceiling with winged genii, plant candelabra, three curved friezes with grotesque animals. “21” above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, The Siren's Grotto at Tivoli, ca. 1813. Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and brown watercolor on cream laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2086
